18#include "QRAlignmentPatternFinder.h"
19#include "QRAlignmentPattern.h"
20#include "BitMatrix.h"
21#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"
22
23#include <array>
24#include <cmath>
25#include <cstdlib>
26#include <limits>
27
28namespace ZXing {
29namespace QRCode {
30
31
32using StateCount = std::array<int, 3>;
33
34/**
35* Given a count of black/white/black pixels just seen and an end position,
36* figures the location of the center of this black/white/black run.
37*/
38static float CenterFromEnd(const StateCount& stateCount, int end)
39{
40 return static_cast<float>(end - stateCount[2]) - stateCount[1] / 2.0f;
41}
42
43/**
44* @param stateCount count of black/white/black pixels just read
45* @return true iff the proportions of the counts is close enough to the 1/1/1 ratios
46* used by alignment patterns to be considered a match
47*/
48static bool FoundPatternCross(const StateCount& stateCount, float moduleSize)
49{
50 float maxVariance = moduleSize / 2.0f;
51 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
52 if (std::fabs(moduleSize - stateCount[i]) >= maxVariance) {
53 return false;
54 }
55 }
56 return true;
57}
58
59/**
60* <p>After a horizontal scan finds a potential alignment pattern, this method
61* "cross-checks" by scanning down vertically through the center of the possible
62* alignment pattern to see if the same proportion is detected.</p>
63*
64* @param startI row where an alignment pattern was detected
65* @param centerJ center of the section that appears to cross an alignment pattern
66* @param maxCount maximum reasonable number of modules that should be
67* observed in any reading state, based on the results of the horizontal scan
68* @return vertical center of alignment pattern, or {@link Float#NaN} if not found
69*/
70static float CrossCheckVertical(const BitMatrix& image, int startI, int centerJ, int maxCount, int originalStateCountTotal, float moduleSize)
71{
72 int maxI = image.height();
73 StateCount stateCount = {};
74
75 // Start counting up from center
76 int i = startI;
77 while (i >= 0 && image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[1] <= maxCount) {
78 stateCount[1]++;
79 i--;
80 }
81 // If already too many modules in this state or ran off the edge:
82 if (i < 0 || stateCount[1] > maxCount) {
83 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
84 }
85 while (i >= 0 && !image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[0] <= maxCount) {
86 stateCount[0]++;
87 i--;
88 }
89 if (stateCount[0] > maxCount) {
90 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
91 }
92
93 // Now also count down from center
94 i = startI + 1;
95 while (i < maxI && image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[1] <= maxCount) {
96 stateCount[1]++;
97 i++;
98 }
99 if (i == maxI || stateCount[1] > maxCount) {
100 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
101 }
102 while (i < maxI && !image.get(centerJ, i) && stateCount[2] <= maxCount) {
103 stateCount[2]++;
104 i++;
105 }
106 if (stateCount[2] > maxCount) {
107 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
108 }
109
110 int stateCountTotal = Reduce(stateCount);
111 if (5 * std::abs(stateCountTotal - originalStateCountTotal) >= 2 * originalStateCountTotal) {
112 return std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
113 }
114
115 return FoundPatternCross(stateCount, moduleSize) ? CenterFromEnd(stateCount, i) : std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
116}
117
118/**
119* <p>This is called when a horizontal scan finds a possible alignment pattern. It will
120* cross check with a vertical scan, and if successful, will see if this pattern had been
121* found on a previous horizontal scan. If so, we consider it confirmed and conclude we have
122* found the alignment pattern.</p>
123*
124* @param stateCount reading state module counts from horizontal scan
125* @param i row where alignment pattern may be found
126* @param j end of possible alignment pattern in row
127* @return {@link AlignmentPattern} if we have found the same pattern twice, or null if not
128*/
129static AlignmentPattern
130HandlePossibleCenter(const BitMatrix& image, const StateCount& stateCount, int i, int j, float moduleSize, std::vector<AlignmentPattern>& possibleCenters)
131{
132 int stateCountTotal = Reduce(stateCount);
133 float centerJ = CenterFromEnd(stateCount, j);
134 float centerI = CrossCheckVertical(image, i, static_cast<int>(centerJ), 2 * stateCount[1], stateCountTotal, moduleSize);
135 if (!std::isnan(centerI)) {
136 float estimatedModuleSize = stateCountTotal / 3.0f;
137 for (const AlignmentPattern& center : possibleCenters) {
138 // Look for about the same center and module size:
139 if (center.aboutEquals(estimatedModuleSize, centerI, centerJ)) {
140 return center.combineEstimate(centerI, centerJ, estimatedModuleSize);
141 }
142 }
143 // Hadn't found this before; save it
144 possibleCenters.emplace_back(centerJ, centerI, estimatedModuleSize);
145 }
146 return {};
147}
148
149AlignmentPattern
150AlignmentPatternFinder::Find(const BitMatrix& image, int startX, int startY, int width, int height, float moduleSize)
151{
152 int maxJ = startX + width;
153 int middleI = startY + (height / 2);
154 std::vector<AlignmentPattern> possibleCenters;
155 possibleCenters.reserve(5);
156
157 // We are looking for black/white/black modules in 1:1:1 ratio;
158 // this tracks the number of black/white/black modules seen so far
159 for (int iGen = 0; iGen < height; iGen++) {
160 // Search from middle outwards
161 StateCount stateCount = {};
162 int i = middleI + ((iGen & 0x01) == 0 ? (iGen + 1) / 2 : -((iGen + 1) / 2));
163 int j = startX;
164 // Burn off leading white pixels before anything else; if we start in the middle of
165 // a white run, it doesn't make sense to count its length, since we don't know if the
166 // white run continued to the left of the start point
167 while (j < maxJ && !image.get(j, i)) {
168 j++;
169 }
170 int currentState = 0;
171 while (j < maxJ) {
172 if (image.get(j, i)) {
173 // Black pixel
174 if (currentState == 1) { // Counting black pixels
175 stateCount[1]++;
176 }
177 else { // Counting white pixels
178 if (currentState == 2) { // A winner?
179 if (FoundPatternCross(stateCount, moduleSize)) { // Yes
180 auto result = HandlePossibleCenter(image, stateCount, i, j, moduleSize, possibleCenters);
181 if (result.isValid())
182 return result;
183 }
184 stateCount[0] = stateCount[2];
185 stateCount[1] = 1;
186 stateCount[2] = 0;
187 currentState = 1;
188 }
189 else {
190 stateCount[++currentState]++;
191 }
192 }
193 }
194 else { // White pixel
195 if (currentState == 1) { // Counting black pixels
196 currentState++;
197 }
198 stateCount[currentState]++;
199 }
200 j++;
201 }
202 if (FoundPatternCross(stateCount, moduleSize)) {
203 auto result = HandlePossibleCenter(image, stateCount, i, maxJ, moduleSize, possibleCenters);
204 if (result.isValid())
205 return result;
206 }
207
208 }
209
210 // Hmm, nothing we saw was observed and confirmed twice. If we had
211 // any guess at all, return it.
212 if (!possibleCenters.empty()) {
213 return possibleCenters.front();
214 }
215
216 return {};
217}
218
219} // QRCode
220} // ZXing
